text: Gaius Aquillius Florus was a consul of the Roman Republic in the year 259 BC. His colleague was Lucius Cornelius Scipio. During the First Punic War, Aquillius Florus was proconsul of Sicily for the year 258T.R.S. Broughton, The Magistrates of the Roman Republic (American Philological Association, 1951, 1986), vol. 1, p. 206, citing Zonaras 8.11 and Polybius 1.24.8. and monitored the movements of the Carthaginian general Hamilcar. ==References== Category:Roman Republican consuls Category:3rd-century BC Romans Florus, Gaius
title: Gaius Aquillius Florus
